revised_title: Molten Salt Structures: A Reverse Monte Carlo Analysis
tldr: The authors used the Reverse Monte Carlo method to model the three-dimensional structures of thirteen molten metal halide salts. They determined dominant structural symmetries of short-range order using bond angle correlations and spherical harmonic invariants. The study provides a visual picture of intermediate-range order in molten salts and sheds light on their local structural ordering and interatomic forces.
